content: Thanks a lot for writing this and for your advices on how you’re dealing with this kind of complexity every former-developer-now-manager meets. Having done the switch around 6–7 years ago, I can tell you that keeping technical skills up-to-date is the hardest thing to do. One day you’ll realize that technology moves too fast for you. And that day you’ll have to again make a choice : having a break for taking back tech knowledge, or moving on and really switching on management skills. And I guess this might lead to another great post from you ;-)
